data.title: Samajwadi Party MP Iqra Hasan Highlights Transportation Issues in Kairana
data.meta_description: Samajwadi Party MP Iqra Munawwar Hasan from Kairana, Uttar Pradesh, emphasized the lack of transportation facilities in her constituency. She highlighted the need for a train line connecting Haryana and Western UP, and the absence of train services to Prayagraj and Vaishno Devi. In her first speech in the Lok Sabha, she stressed the importance of addressing these issues. Hasan won the Kairana seat with a significant margin, contributing to the Samajwadi Party's success in the Uttar Pradesh Lok Sabha polls.
data.text:
Samajwadi Party MP from Kairana, Uttar Pradesh, Iqra Munawwar Hasan, has raised concerns about the lack of transportation facilities in her constituency. She pointed out the need for a train line that connects Haryana and Western UP, which would greatly benefit the region.

“Our district is a new district, formed 10 years ago from Muzaffarnagar. We lack many essential facilities, especially local transportation like trains. A line connecting Haryana and Western UP has been a long-standing demand,” Hasan said.

She also mentioned the absence of train services to Prayagraj, where the High Court is located, and to Vaishno Devi, a popular pilgrimage site. “We have many devotees who face problems due to the lack of train services. We are working to address these issues,” she added.

In her maiden speech in the Lok Sabha, Hasan emphasized the need for rail connectivity between Shamli, Prayagraj, and Vaishno Devi. She won the Kairana seat against BJP’s Pradeep Kumar with a margin of 69,116 votes. The Samajwadi Party emerged as the single largest party in the Uttar Pradesh Lok Sabha polls, winning 37 seats. SP Chief Akhilesh Yadav and leader Dimple Yadav also won their respective seats with large margins. The BJP secured 33 seats, losing several key constituencies.

Doubts Revealed
